TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit RawAcl extends System.Security.AccessControl.GenericAcl

remarks.format: ## Remarks The RawAcl class allows full manipulation of Access Control Entries (ACEs). It does not enforce ordering rules for ACEs and does not provide validation logic. Any ACE can be inserted, modified, or removed at any location in the ACL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8 revision, int32 capacity) cil managed

Docs.param: The revision level of the new Access Control List (ACL).
The number of Access Control Entries (ACEs) this object can contain. This number is to be used only as a hint.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified revision level.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] binaryForm, int32 offset) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of byte values that represent an Access Control List (ACL).
The offset in the `binaryForm` parameter at which to begin unmarshaling data.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified binary form.

Gets the length, in bytes, of the binary representation of the current object. This length should be used before marshaling the ACL into a binary array with the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.RawAcl.GetBinaryForm%2A> method.
Docs.value: The length, in bytes, of the binary representation of the current object.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of access control entries (ACEs) in the current object.
Docs.value: The number of ACEs in the current object.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance void GetBinaryForm(unsigned int8[] binaryForm, int32 offset) cil managed

Docs.param: The byte array into which the contents of the is marshaled.
The offset at which to start marshaling.
Docs.summary: Marshals the contents of the object into the specified byte array beginning at the specified offset.
Docs.exception: is negative or too high to allow the entire to be copied into .

MemberSignature.Value: public void InsertAce (int index, System.Security.AccessControl.GenericAce ace);
.method public hidebysig instance void InsertAce(int32 index, class System.Security.AccessControl.GenericAce ace) cil managed

Docs.param: The position at which to add the new ACE. Specify the value of the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.RawAcl.Count%2A> property to insert an ACE at the end of the object.
Docs.summary: Inserts the specified Access Control Entry (ACE) at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The inserted ACE is not cloned before insertion, so any modifications to the ACE after it has been inserted are reflected in the Access Control List (ACL).

Docs.exception: is negative or too high to allow the entire to be copied into .

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.AccessControl.GenericAce this[int index] { get; set; }

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the ACE to get or set.
Docs.summary: Gets or sets the Access Control Entry (ACE) at the specified index.
Docs.value: The ACE at the specified index.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveAce(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The zero-based index of the ACE to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes the Access Control Entry (ACE) at the specified location.
Docs.exception: The value of the parameter is higher than the value of the <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.RawAcl.Count%2A> property minus one or is negative.
